testpoints_invalid = [
    {'varname': 'PROD_AGRO_MEAT_yoy', 'freq': 'a', 'year': 2016, 'value': 30724.0},
    {'varname': 'PROD_AGRO_MEAT_yoy', 'freq': 'a', 'year': 2016, 'value': 99.8},
]

testpoint_1999 = {'freq': 'a', 'value': 4823.0, 'varname': 'GDP_bln_rub', 'year': 1999}


[docs]class DatapointsFromActualDataset(unittest.TestCase):


[docs]    def setUp(self):
        csv_dicts = get_actual_csv_dicts_for_testing()
        pdef = get_pdef()
        self.d = Datapoints(csv_dicts, pdef)
        self.output = list(x for x in self.d.emit('a') if x['year']==2016) 



[docs]class TestDatapoints_Array_Length_Long_Enough(DatapointsFromActualDataset):

[docs]    def test_positive(self):
        assert len(self.d.datapoints) > 21000

# FIXME - this test is failing


[docs]class TestDatapoints_Includes_FirstDatapoint(DatapointsFromActualDataset):

[docs]    def test_positive(self):
        assert self.d.is_included(testpoint_1999)
        assert self.d.datapoints[0] == testpoint_1999



[docs]class TestDatapoints_Include_ManyDatapoints_for_2016_Annual_Data(DatapointsFromActualDataset):

[docs]    def test_positive(self):
        for t in testpoints_valid:
            assert t in self.output



[docs]    def test_negative(self):
        for t in testpoints_invalid:
            assert t not in self.output


if __name__ == '__main__':  
    unittest.main()
    s = DatapointsFromActualDataset()
